number of helpful: 13 of 13 people (100%) found this review helpful4 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 27, 2016
												3.2/10 - Mini Bikes Bring on Micro Fun!This game could have been a winner with a few tweaks; however these didn't happen and you are left with a pretty poor racing game. The biggest complaint is the actual racing; if you fall behind the pack there is no chance of catching back up. This really sucks since there are interesting maps, power-ups different racing modes.The game really got me excited with the power-ups; it reminded me of our beloved Mario Kart. The problem is if you aren't in a pack of racers you will never get to really utilize these power-ups since the map is so curvy and the other racers will already be half a lap in front of you. No controller support and barely enough keyboard customization. Worth $0.20-0.30; just so you can make a profit with the cards. Accidently ReviewedWas this review helpful or maybe even not helpful? Either way join this group for more. Free Keys and Reviews weekly!
 Steam Group: AccidentlyReviewed

Posted: November 15, 2015
												Ok, i watched the trailer to the game and i tought: "this game looks cool"Well, its notThis game is pretty much a Mario Kart, but for mobile port and then converted to pcIs it good? Well, lets see:PROS:-Driving is kinda cool-Variety of Power UpsCONS:-Physics are terrible-At the start, races seem impossible to win-AI crashes into you, you get wiped-Players bike starts flying out of nowhere-Tracks are kinda booring-Game informations says that it has multiplayer... where?-Graphics are terrible-You crash into AI, you get wipedThis game as potential but as it stands right now, you should avoid it.

												It's not a bad little game, controls are a little tricky to master but after a couple of races it's a piece of cake. content:
Posted: January 21
												I'm sorry but, NO...If you're 12 this is probably a fun game, but otherwise life is too short to waste time on it. I'll yield that multiplayer might be enjoyable (it seems like it would with the tournaments and online series) but I lost interest before getting around to trying any of it.There are better implementations of the Wacky Wheels / Mario Kart game type available - MiniBikers is just missing "something".And the nauseating F-Zero "steering the world" style pov does not help matters on the short, tight-cornered tracks. Some people actually like it, but after 5 minutes I wanted to yell at my shoes.
